intro: Heliophila latisiliqua, commonly known as the broad-leaved heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Heliophila latisiliqua is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
